question.text: Which of these differences between male and female cockroaches (Periplaneta americana) is correct?

options.text: The testis in male cockroach is longer than the ovary in female cockroach.
The male cockroach has anal cerci while female cockroach has an anal style.
The male cockroach has one chromosome less than the female cockroach.
The spermatheca is found in male cockroach while ootheca is found in the female cockroach.

solution.text: The male reproductive system of cockroach consists of a pair of testes lying on each lateral side in the 4<sup>th</sup> -6<sup>th</sup> abdominal segments. The female reproductive system of cockroach consists of two large ovaries, lying laterally in the 2<sup>nd</sup> - 6<sup>th </sup>abdominal segments. Thus ovaries are longer than testes. Males bear a pair of short, threadlike anal styles which are absent in females. In both sexes, the 10<sup>th</sup> segment bears a pair of jointed filamentous structures called anal cerci. A pair of spermatheca is present in the 6th segment of female cockroach which opens into the genital chamber. Their fertilized eggs are encased in capsules called oothecae. Periplaneta americana has a <math><mi mathvariant="normal">X</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">X</mi><mo>-</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">X</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi></math> type of sex determination. Females have 34 chromosomes <math><mo>(</mo><mn>32</mn><mo>+</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">X</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">X</mi><mo>)</mo></math> and males have 33 chromosomes <math><mo>(</mo><mn>32</mn><mo>+</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">X</mi><mo>).</mo></math>
